relation_pairs: macro_rules! write { ( $ dst : expr , $ ( $ arg : tt ) * ) => { ... }; }
Write formatted data into a buffer.
This macro accepts a format string, a list of arguments, and a 'writer'.
Arguments will be formatted according to the specified format string and the result will be passed to the writer.
The writer may be any value with a write_fmt method; generally this comes from an implementation of either the std::fmt::Write or the std::io::Write trait.
The macro returns whatever the write_fmt method returns; commonly a std::fmt::Result, or an io::Result.
See std::fmt for more information on the format string syntax.
